description.zh-cn: 明末民变领袖，大顺政权开国皇帝。
description.en: A leader of the late Ming peasant rebellions and the founding emperor of the Dashun regime.

description.zh-cn: 由李自成于1644年在西安建立的政权。
description.en: A regime established by Li Zicheng in Xi'an in 1644.

description.zh-cn: 明朝的末代皇帝。
description.en: The last emperor of the Ming dynasty.

description.zh-cn: 中国的朝代，于1644年被李自成领导的农民起义军所灭亡。
description.en: A Chinese dynasty that was overthrown by the peasant rebel army led by Li Zicheng in 1644.

description.zh-cn: 中国的朝代，击败李自成并取代明朝统治中国。
description.en: A Chinese dynasty that defeated Li Zicheng and replaced the Ming dynasty to rule China.

description.zh-cn: 指1644年李自成攻入北京，崇祯帝自缢，明朝灭亡的事件。
description.en: Refers to the event in 1644 when Li Zicheng captured Beijing, leading to the suicide of the Chongzhen Emperor and the fall of the Ming dynasty.

description.zh-cn: 明末清初将领，在山海关投降清朝，引清兵入关击败李自成。
description.en: A general in the late Ming and early Qing dynasties who surrendered to the Qing at Shanhai Pass and led Qing forces to defeat Li Zicheng.

description.zh-cn: 清朝摄政王，指挥清军入关。
description.en: The Prince Regent of the Qing dynasty who commanded the Qing forces' entry into central China.

description.zh-cn: 李自成与吴三桂、清军在山海关的一场决战，李自成在此战中大败。
description.en: A decisive battle at Shanhai Pass between Li Zicheng and the combined forces of Wu Sangui and the Qing army, resulting in a major defeat for Li Zicheng.

description.zh-cn: 李自成麾下大将，以对明朝官员酷刑追赃闻名。
description.en: A general under Li Zicheng, known for torturing Ming officials to extract wealth.

description.zh-cn: 明末将领，曾多次击败农民军，后在潼关兵败被杀。
description.en: A late Ming general who defeated rebel armies multiple times but was ultimately defeated and killed at Tongguan.

description.zh-cn: 明末民变领袖，号称“闯王”，是李自成的舅父及早期领袖。
description.en: A leader of the late Ming peasant rebellions, known as the 'Dashing King,' who was Li Zicheng's maternal uncle and early leader.

description.zh-cn: 崇祯皇帝采纳大臣建议，裁撤全国驿站的政策，导致包括李自成在内的大量驿卒失业，成为明末民变的原因之一。
description.en: A policy during the Chongzhen era, based on ministerial advice, to abolish post stations nationwide. This led to widespread unemployment among station staff, including Li Zicheng, and became one of the causes of the late Ming peasant rebellions.

description.zh-cn: 明朝负责传递朝廷公文的机构。
description.en: An institution in the Ming dynasty responsible for transmitting official documents.

description.zh-cn: 举人，因李自成欠债而将其告官，后被李自成杀死。
description.en: A holder of the Juren degree who reported Li Zicheng for an unpaid debt and was later killed by him.

description.zh-cn: 李自成的第一任妻子，因与人通奸而被李自成所杀。
description.en: Li Zicheng's first wife, whom he killed for committing adultery.

description.zh-cn: 明神宗之子，封为福王。1641年李自成攻克洛阳时被杀。
description.en: Son of the Wanli Emperor, enfeoffed as the Prince of Fu. He was killed when Li Zicheng captured Luoyang in 1641.

description.zh-cn: 河南省会，李自成曾三次围攻此城，最终因黄河决堤而城破。
description.en: The provincial capital of Henan, which Li Zicheng besieged three times. The city eventually fell after the Yellow River dikes were breached.

description.zh-cn: 明末重要将领，负责镇压农民起义，后降清。
description.en: An important late Ming general responsible for suppressing peasant rebellions, who later surrendered to the Qing.

description.zh-cn: 李自成的侄子，大顺政权重要将领。
description.en: Li Zicheng's nephew and a key general in the Dashun regime.

description.zh-cn: 李自成三弟，在李自成死后被推举为大顺军领袖。
description.en: Li Zicheng's third younger brother, who was proclaimed leader of the Dashun army after Li Zicheng's death.

description.zh-cn: 清朝亲王，率军追击李自成。
description.en: A Qing dynasty prince who led the army in pursuit of Li Zicheng.

description.zh-cn: 中国现代学者、作家，于1944年发表《甲申三百年祭》，分析李自成失败的原因。
description.en: A modern Chinese scholar and writer who published 'Commemorating the 300th Anniversary of the Jiashen Year' in 1944, analyzing the reasons for Li Zicheng's failure.

description.zh-cn: 郭沫若于1944年3月发表的历史评论文章，讨论了李自成政权迅速败亡的原因，在国共两党内部均产生重要影响。
description.en: A historical commentary published by Guo Moruo in March 1944, discussing the reasons for the rapid collapse of Li Zicheng's regime, which had a significant impact within both the Kuomintang and the Communist Party.

description.zh-cn: 明朝首都，于1644年被李自成攻克。
description.en: The capital of the Ming dynasty, captured by Li Zicheng in 1644.

description.zh-cn: 1644年正月初一，李自成在西安称帝，建国号“大顺”。
description.en: On the first day of the first lunar month in 1644, Li Zicheng proclaimed himself emperor in Xi'an and established the state of 'Dashun'.

description.zh-cn: 李自成是大顺政权的第一任皇帝。
description.en: Li Zicheng was the first emperor of the Dashun regime.

description.zh-cn: 李自成自1629年起兵反明，直至1644年攻入北京导致明朝灭亡。
description.en: Li Zicheng rebelled against the Ming from 1629 until he captured Beijing in 1644, leading to the dynasty's collapse.

description.zh-cn: 李自成率军攻克北京，直接导致了甲申之变。
description.en: Li Zicheng's capture of Beijing directly led to the Jiashen Incident.

description.zh-cn: 在李自成军攻入北京后，崇祯帝于景山自缢身亡。
description.en: After Li Zicheng's army captured Beijing, the Chongzhen Emperor committed suicide at Jingshan.

description.zh-cn: 甲申之变标志着明朝作为统一政权的灭亡。
description.en: The Jiashen Incident marked the end of the Ming dynasty as a unified regime.

description.zh-cn: 李自成在山海关一片石战役中被吴三桂与清军联军击败，从此由盛转衰。
description.en: Li Zicheng was defeated by the allied forces of Wu Sangui and the Qing army at the Battle of Shanhai Pass (Yipianshi), marking a turning point from his ascendancy to decline.

description.zh-cn: 吴三桂在山海关投降清朝，并联合清军在一片石战役中击败李自成。
description.en: Wu Sangui surrendered to the Qing dynasty at Shanhai Pass and, in alliance with Qing forces, defeated Li Zicheng at the Battle of Yipianshi.

description.zh-cn: 清朝摄政王多尔衮接受吴三桂投降，并指挥清军与吴三桂联军在一片石战役中击败李自成。
description.en: Qing regent Dorgon accepted Wu Sangui's surrender and commanded the joint Qing-Wu forces to defeat Li Zicheng at the Battle of Yipianshi.

description.zh-cn: 李自成东征讨伐驻守山海关的吴三桂，吴三桂降清导致李自成大败。李自成逃回北京后，杀吴三桂家大小34口。
description.en: Li Zicheng marched east to attack Wu Sangui, who was garrisoned at Shanhai Pass. Wu's surrender to the Qing led to Li's major defeat. After fleeing back to Beijing, Li Zicheng executed 34 members of Wu Sangui's family.

description.zh-cn: 在一片石战役后，清军持续追击李自成，最终导致其在湖北九宫山败亡。
description.en: After the Battle of Yipianshi, Qing forces continuously pursued Li Zicheng, ultimately leading to his defeat and death at Jiugong Mountain in Hubei.

description.zh-cn: 1633年，李自成投奔舅父“闯王”高迎祥，被称为“闯将”。高迎祥死后，李自成被推为新任“闯王”。
description.en: In 1633, Li Zicheng joined his maternal uncle, 'Dashing King' Gao Yingxiang, and was known as the 'Dashing General'. After Gao's death, Li Zicheng was acclaimed as the new 'Dashing King'.

description.zh-cn: 因明朝裁撤驿站，担任驿卒的李自成被裁员失业，这是他后来起兵的原因之一。
description.en: Due to the Ming dynasty's abolition of post stations, Li Zicheng, who was a station staffer, was laid off. This was one of the reasons for his subsequent rebellion.

description.zh-cn: 李自成早年曾在明朝驿站担任负责照看马匹的驿卒。
description.en: In his early years, Li Zicheng worked as a staff member responsible for tending horses at a Ming dynasty post station.

description.zh-cn: 因欠债被举人艾诏告官并受辱后，李自成于年底杀死了债主艾诏。
description.en: After being reported to the authorities and humiliated by Juren degree holder Ai Zhao over a debt, Li Zicheng killed his creditor at the end of the year.

description.zh-cn: 李自成因妻子韩金儿与人通奸而杀死了她。
description.en: Li Zicheng killed his wife, Han Jin'er, for committing adultery.

description.zh-cn: 1641年攻克洛阳后，李自成杀死明朝福王朱常洵，并用其血肉与鹿肉煮成“福禄宴”与将士共享。
description.en: After capturing Luoyang in 1641, Li Zicheng killed the Ming Prince of Fu, Zhu Changxun, and reportedly cooked his flesh with venison to create a 'Fu Lu Banquet' to share with his soldiers.

description.zh-cn: 1643年10月，李自成攻破潼关，杀死了明朝督师孙传庭。
description.en: In October 1643, Li Zicheng broke through Tongguan Pass and killed the Ming Grand Coordinator Sun Chuanting.

description.zh-cn: 李自成在1641至1642年间三度围攻开封。在第三次围城期间，黄河决堤，导致城中大量平民死亡，城市被毁。
description.en: Li Zicheng besieged Kaifeng three times between 1641 and 1642. During the third siege, the Yellow River dikes were breached, causing the deaths of many civilians and the destruction of the city.

description.zh-cn: 洪承畴作为明朝三边总督，曾多次率军围剿包括李自成在内的农民起义军。
description.en: As the Ming Viceroy of the Three Borders, Hong Chengchou led multiple campaigns to suppress peasant rebel armies, including Li Zicheng's forces.

description.zh-cn: 刘宗敏是李自成麾下的核心将领之一。
description.en: Liu Zongmin was one of the core generals under Li Zicheng's command.

description.zh-cn: 李过是李自成的侄子，也是其麾下重要将领，被封为滋侯。
description.en: Li Guo was Li Zicheng's nephew and an important general under his command, enfeoffed as the Marquis of Zi.

description.zh-cn: 李过是李自成的侄子。
description.en: Li Guo was Li Zicheng's nephew.

description.zh-cn: 李自敬是李自成的三弟。
description.en: Li Zijing was Li Zicheng's third younger brother.

description.zh-cn: 在李自成死后，李过推举李自成的三弟李自敬为大顺军首领。
description.en: After Li Zicheng's death, Li Guo supported the proclamation of Li Zicheng's third younger brother, Li Zijing, as the leader of the Dashun army.

description.zh-cn: 清朝入关后，阿济格率领一路大军负责追击李自成，并多次击败大顺军。
description.en: After the Qing forces entered through the pass, Ajige led one of the main armies to pursue Li Zicheng and defeated the Dashun forces multiple times.

description.zh-cn: 郭沫若于1944年3月在重庆发表了《甲申三百年祭》。
description.en: Guo Moruo published 'Commemorating the 300th Anniversary of the Jiashen Year' in Chongqing in March 1944.

description.zh-cn: 《甲申三百年祭》通过分析李自成进入北京后因骄傲腐化而迅速失败的历史，对后世关于李自成的历史评价产生了深远影响。
description.en: 'Commemorating the 300th Anniversary of the Jiashen Year' profoundly influenced later historical evaluations of Li Zicheng by analyzing his rapid failure due to arrogance and corruption after entering Beijing.
